title: Breaking Bad's Aaron Paul and Bryan Cranston reunite at El Camino premiere
text:
Breaking Bad’s Aaron Paul reunites with Bryan Cranston (Picture: Getty Images)

Breaking Bad stars Aaron Paul and Bryan Craston have reunited to celebrate the launch of their upcoming movie El Camino.

The duo looked suave as they arrived at the Los Angeles premiere where they posed up a storm in front of a classic car in anticipation of their latest hit.

Wrapping his arm around his co-star, the Walter White actor beamed down the lens as he rocked a white shirt and plain blue suit.

While his buddy looked worlds apart from his character Jesse Pinkman in a grey suit that he’d matched with a black t-shirt.

Aaron had arrived at the lavish event with his wife Lauren Parsekian, who had opted to wear a dalmatian print dress.

The attended the Los Angeles premiere of El Camino (Picture: Backgrid)

The Jesse Pinkman star was joined by his wife (Picture: Getty Images)

The pair appeared all loved up as they laughed away with one another in front of the cameras.

Advertisement

Advertisement

Krysten Ritter, who played Jane in the original series also made an appearance, but it was Dean Norris, who played DEA agent Hank Schrader, who stole the show .

The 56-year-old toasted the evening with a bottle of booze as he joined the rest of the OG cast.

Yes, the likes of Jonathan Banks, Giancarlo Esposito and Jesse Plemons all showed up for the evening – and it looks like they had a blast.

Dean Norris stole the show (Picture: Invision)

Krysten Ritter made sure she was in attendance (Picture: Getty Images)

The full cast of the upcoming hit has yet to be revealed (Picture: Paul Smith/Featureflash)

The full cast of El Camino is yet to be announced, keeping fans in the dark as to whether or not Bryan Cranston will reprise his role.

However, the new trailer has everyone convinced that the star of the show will return – and we are just too excited.

At the end of the teaser, Jesse is seen coming face-to-face with a mysterious character, who asks him: ‘You ready?’

He simply replies ‘Yeah’, with no ‘b***h’, proving he really has changed a little.

Kirsten Dunst and Jesse Plemons looked in good spirits (Picture: MEGA)

To view this video please enable JavaScript, and consider upgrading to a web browser that supports HTML5 video

Even Mark Hamill turned out to the occasion (Picture: Getty Images)

The film picks up after the season five finale, where Jesse escaped his white supremacist captors in a Chevrolet El Camino and drove to freedom.

Advertisement

Advertisement

‘El Camino centers on what happens to Jesse after he drives out of that compound covered in physical and psychological scars, and it features more than 10 familiar characters from the show,’ reports claim.

Three of these places are taken up already by the confirmed Jesse Pinkman (Aaron Paul), Skinny Pete (Charles Baker), and Brandon ‘Badger’ Mayhew (Matt Jones).

This leaves the door wide open for the return of Skyler White (Anna Gunn), Marie Schrader (Betsy Brandt), and Saul Goodman (Bob Odenkirk).

And yes, we’re still holding out hope that Walt will make some kind of comeback – despite his tragic end.

El Camino: A Breaking Bad Movie releases 11 October on Netflix.

description: Breaking Bad's Aaron Paul reunites with Bryan Cranston as they celebrate El Camino premiere.
